greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of triple-crossings of diagonals in the regular 2n-gon.
comment: Same as (total number of triangles visible in convex 2n-gon with all diagonals drawn in general position) - (total number of triangles visible in regular 2n-gon with all diagonals drawn).
Number of triple-crossings of diagonals in the regular 2n+1-gon is 0.
See Sillke 1998 (where a(n) is called "T(2n)") for explanations and extensive annotated references.
See A005732 and A006600 for more comments, references, links, formulas, examples, programs, and lists from which to compute a(n) = A005732(2n) - A006600(2n) up to n = 500.
link: T. Sillke, Number of triangles for a convex n-gon, 1998.
example: With only 2 diagonals in a 4-gon, there can be no triple-crossings, so a(2) = 0.
xref: Sequences related to chords in a circle: A001006, A054726, A006533, A006561, A006600, A007569, A007678. See also entries for chord diagrams in Index file.
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Jul 25 2015
